channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HADOOP-7639] yarn ui not properly filtered in HttpServer
item.description: Currently httpserver only has .html", ".jsp as user facing urls when you add a filter. For the new web framework in yarn, the pages no longer have the .html or *.jsp and thus they are not properly being filtered. The yarn ui just uses paths - for it would be serve:port/yarn/
item.summary: yarn ui not properly filtered in HttpServer

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.

comments.comment: I think the HttpServer needs to have a new constructor that allows the caller to pass in the path specifications that the server will be servicing. the new constructor can then add those paths to the any existing filters - similar to if you add a Servlet.

-1 overall. Here are the results of testing the latest attachment
http://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12494643/HADOOP-7639.patch
against trunk revision .

+1 @author. The patch does not contain any @author tags.

+1 tests included. The patch appears to include 6 new or modified tests.

+1 javadoc. The javadoc tool did not generate any warning messages.

+1 javac. The applied patch does not increase the total number of javac compiler warnings.

+1 findbugs. The patch does not introduce any new Findbugs (version 1.3.9) warnings.

-1 release audit. The applied patch generated 9 release audit warnings (more than the trunk's current 0 warnings).

+1 core tests. The patch passed unit tests in .

+1 contrib tests. The patch passed contrib unit tests.

Test results: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HADOOP-Build/189//testReport/
Release audit warnings: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HADOOP-Build/189//artifact/trunk/patchprocess/patchReleaseAuditProblems.txt
Console output: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HADOOP-Build/189//console

release audit warnings were introduced elsewhere and being fixed with https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/HADOOP-7641.

The real link to the warnings is: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HADOOP-Build/189/artifact/trunk/hadoop-common-project/patchprocess/patchReleaseAuditProblems.txt
HADOOP-7641 is fixed. Reattaching the same to trigger Jenkins.

Reattaching the same to trigger Jenkins.

Same patch I mean.

+1 overall. Here are the results of testing the latest attachment
http://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12495215/HADOOP-7639.patch
against trunk revision .

+1 @author. The patch does not contain any @author tags.

+1 tests included. The patch appears to include 6 new or modified tests.

+1 javadoc. The javadoc tool did not generate any warning messages.

+1 javac. The applied patch does not increase the total number of javac compiler warnings.

+1 findbugs. The patch does not introduce any new Findbugs (version 1.3.9) warnings.

+1 release audit. The applied patch does not increase the total number of release audit warnings.

+1 core tests. The patch passed unit tests in .

+1 contrib tests. The patch passed contrib unit tests.

Test results: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HADOOP-Build/208//testReport/
Console output: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HADOOP-Build/208//console

This message is automatically generated.

Integrated in Hadoop-Common-trunk-Commit #920 (See https://builds.apache.org/job/Hadoop-Common-trunk-Commit/920/)
HADOOP-7639. Enhance HttpServer to allow passing path-specs for filtering, so that servers like Yarn WebApp can get filtered the paths served by their own injected servlets. Contributed by Thomas Graves.
